worklogs.comment:
zhijunfu commented on pull request #4389: ARROW-5402: [Plasma] add support to pin objects in plasma store
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4389
 
 
   This adds support to pin an object in plasma store, which is useful in some scenarios (e.g. we want to ensure the actor creation task arguments won't be evicted from plasma so that actor can be re-constructed when it crashes).  
   
   This is done by specifying a flag when creating an object, if the flag is set, then the object won't be managed by LRU cache in plasma, and thus won't be evicted even when its reference count drops to zero, it can only be removed by an explicit `Delete()` call.
   
   @pcmoritz @robertnishihara @guoyuhong  could you please help take a look? thanks.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

zhijunfu commented on issue #4389: ARROW-5402: [Plasma] add support to pin objects in plasma store
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4389#issuecomment-496241563
 
 
   > There is no a separate API to pin the object , so the pinned property could only be set at the creation time, right?
   
   Yes, this allows us to ensure the object cannot be evicted right after its creation, if it's implemented as a separate API there's still a window that the object can be evicted. We can add another separate API later if we have such scenarios that specifying the flag at creation doesn't meet the requirement.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4389#discussion_r287825879
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/plasma/client.cc
 ##########
 @@ -208,10 +208,11 @@ class PlasmaClient::Impl : public std::enable_shared_from_this<PlasmaClient::Imp
                  int num_retries = -1);
 
   Status Create(const ObjectID& object_id, int64_t data_size, const uint8_t* metadata,
-                int64_t metadata_size, std::shared_ptr<Buffer>* data, int device_num = 0);
+                int64_t metadata_size, std::shared_ptr<Buffer>* data, int device_num = 0,
+                bool is_pinned = true);
 
 Review comment:
   Good catch, thanks!  Yes these should be aligned, as you mentioned `is_pinned = false` is intended.  The flag was previously call `use_lru` which default to `true`, when converting to `is_pinned` which default to `false`, some of the places are overlooked...

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
[https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/4368]

Sometimes we want to "pin" an object in plasma store - we don't want this object to be deleted even though there's nobody that's currently referencing it. In this case, we can specify a flag when creating the object so that it won't be deleted by LRU cache when its refcnt drops to 0, and can only be deleted by an explicit {{Delete()}} call.

Currently, we found that an actor FO problem. The actor creation task depends on a plasma object put by user. After the the actor running for a long time, the object will be deleted by plasma LRU. Then, an Actor FO happens, the creation task cannot find the object put by user, so the FO is hanging forever.

Would this make sense to you?
